intro: Amsinckia lanceolata, commonly known as the desert gold or yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping. Amsinckia lanceolata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
